title: Search usecases
body:
This issue is to collect and possibly provide answers on how `datalad search` query could/should/does look like to answer formulated question if it could do that.  And if not ATM -- why, e.g.
- **MISSING-META** we have not extracted such metadata yet, but if we adjust/provide needed extractor - should be possible.
- **DESIGN** - we cannot address the usecase because of our metadata extraction/aggregation approach. 
- ???

### ReproNim

#### Level 1: Datasets:

- [ ] **RN1.1** Give me datasets which have a subjects with autism who are adolescents and have genetic data
    - MISSING-META
- [ ] **RN1.2**  Give me all datasets that have MMSE and tell me (return) what types of imaging was performed
    - MISSING-META
- [ ] **RN1.3** Give me all datasets with a visual task where the age of the subject is greater than 60 years
    - MISSING-META (nothing that defines the union of all visual tasks)
- [ ] **RN1.4** Give me all datasets that have multiple time points or multiple sessions (longitudinal data).
    - MISSING-META (I assume this refers to a BIDS dataset, not ANY dataset, but even there I think there is nothing extracted at this point)
#### Level 2: Imaging sessions/scans
- [ ] **RN2.1** Give me images for all typically developing subjects 10-15 years old who have structural scans at 3T
    - MISSING-META (what is typically developing?)
- [ ] **RN2.2** Give me images all right handed subjects with autism who have resting state data with a TR between 1 and 3 seconds in the age range of 18-25 and have ADOS assessment. [and then tell me how many are ‘severe’ (ADOS > 20) and ‘mild’ (ADOS < 20)]
    - MISSING-META (what is right handed?)
- [ ] **RN2.3** Give me the images for subjects that have 2 resting state sessions within a 2-day time frame.
    - MISSING-META (there is no generally used concept of a resting state session). I guess this query wants to discover multi-session datasets, but there is no guarantee that such data would be organized this way.


#### Level 3: Derived Data
- [ ] **RN3.1** Give me all typical subjects that have a corpus callosum volume with freesurfer. [NIDM-R]
    - MISSING-META (i guess NIDM would provide it)

### To be extended
